original: dus su dengs na nyis rim du'o //
analyzed: dus su dengs na nyis rim du'o //

original: phyag dar khrod kyi chad pa med do //

analyzed: tshem bu pa phyag dar khrod nas bsdus shing glon pa ni rim pa'i grangs chad pa med de dus blon du'ang dbang ngo //

original: lhag par mi sbyin /
analyzed: lhag par mi sbyin /

original: lhag par glon pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: lhag par glon pa'i tshe nyes byas /

original: spang bar yang byed do //
analyzed: spang bar yang byed do //

original: mdo ltag ma ltar grangs bcad pa las lhag par sbyor du mi gnang ba las sbyar te zhag bcu 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /üîΩsngags kyang mi 'chags /

original: 'os pa las mi dbral /
analyzed: 'os pa las mi dbral /

analyzed: de bzhin du las byas nas sbyar snyam du sems ma bskyed pas so //

analyzed: bab bab tu phral nas sbyar ba tshun chad bcu 'das na spang ba'o //

analyzed: sbyar ma'i dum bu ni dgu nas nyi shu rtsa lngar te zung ma gtogs so //

analyzed: gsum pa dang po ni leb leb po phyed dang gsum mo //

original: chos gos tshal bu nyi shu gcig pa dang / nyi shu gsum pa dang nyi shu lnga pa gsum ni zheng du 'gor ba'i tshal bu ring po bzhi ring po'i phyed tshad gcig ste /

analyzed: de dga' bar byas te'o //

analyzed: gsol dge slong ma la gos blangs pa dang gnyen ma yin par shes bzhin pa dang yan lag lnga /
translated: If he accepts cloth from a nun who is not a relative, it is a downfall with five factors:

original: gos blangs pa de gos kyang yin pa dang lag tu 'ang thob pa dang yan lag 'di dgu dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gos blangs pa de gos kyang yin pa dang lag tu 'ang thob pa dang yan lag 'di dgu dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur /
translated: The nun is not a relative, he knows she is not a relative, he accepts the cloth, the cloth is cloth, and he obtains it in his hands.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi phyir gos byin pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi phyir gos byin pa'o //
translated: There is no downfall if he accepts cloth for the sake of the community.

original: dge slong mas dge 'dun pho la gos shig yon du phul pa ni blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge 'dun pho la gos shig yon du phul pa ni blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: There is no downfall if a nun offers cloth to the community of monks and he accepts it.

original: legs par bshad pa'i phyir bshad ces /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa'i phyir bshad ces /

original: tshul nas 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i tshe dge slong pas chos bsnyad pa dang dge slong ma la dge slong phas chos bshad pa la yid ches shing dga' ste de lta bu chos bzang po bshad pa la yon phul lo zhes phul na blangs kyang nyes med /

translated: When a fully ordained monk or nun is giving a Dharma teaching, if the other fully ordained person has confidence and delight in the Dharma teaching, and says, ‚ÄúI offer a gift for such an excellent Dharma teaching,‚Äù then it is permissible to accept it.

original: rab tu rdzogs pa'i tshe dang rlag na'o //
analyzed: rab tu rdzogs pa'i tshe dang rlag na'o //
translated: When fully ordained, and when it is lost.

original: dge sbyong pho zhig bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe de yo byad du dge slong mas gos byin pa dang gos stor tam gos chus khyer ram mes tshig gam phrogs te med pa la sogs pa la dge slong mas gos byin na blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong pho zhig bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe de yo byad du dge slong mas gos byin pa dang gos stor tam gos chus khyer ram mes tshig gam phrogs te med pa la sogs pa la dge slong mas gos byin na blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: When a fully ordained monk is fully ordained, if a fully ordained nun gives him clothing, and if his clothing is lost, carried away by water, burned in a fire, or stolen, and so on, then it is permissible to accept clothing given by a fully ordained nun.

original: dad pas nor bdun du bzhag nas smras te mi ltos pas song na yang ngo //
analyzed: dad pas nor bdun du bzhag nas smras te mi ltos pas song na yang ngo //
translated: If she gives it after establishing it as one of the seven types of wealth with faith, and he goes without regard for her, it is also permissible.

original: dge slong mas dge slong la nor sbyin par dad de mdun du bzhag nas mi 'dod ces byas kyang ma btub ste nor bor nas nor la mi ltos par song na nor de blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong la nor sbyin par dad de mdun du bzhag nas mi 'dod ces byas kyang ma btub ste nor bor nas nor la mi ltos par song na nor de blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a nun, out of faith, offers money to a monk, and he puts it in front of him, but does not want it, and she does not insist, and he loses the money, and he goes away without regard for the money, then if he takes that money, there is no offense.

original: gos ma yin pa kha zas lta bu gzhan zhig dge slong phas blangs pa ni nyes byas so //üîΩlen pa'i spang ba ste rnam par 'byed pa'i 'o //

translated: If a monk takes something that is not cloth, such as food, it is an offense of wrong conduct.üîΩThis is the downfall through accepting, from the chapter on the distinctions.

original: len pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: len pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The downfall through accepting is from the Vinaya Verses:

original: // / lag par thob par gyur na /
analyzed: // / lag par thob par gyur na /
translated: If it is obtained in the hand,

original: dge slong ma las gos blangs pa ni bdag gi lag tu thob na spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong ma las gos blangs pa ni bdag gi lag tu thob na spang bar 'gyur /
translated: if a monk accepts cloth from a nun, it is an offense of wrong conduct if it is obtained in his hand.

original: lta ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa de ni snga ma'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa de ni snga ma'o //
translated: If it is in the field of view, it is as before.

original: dge slong ma la gos blangs pa bdag gi lag tu ni ma blangs kyi khyer te 'ongs pa la bdag gi mig gis mthong bar bzhag ste blangs pa yang lag @98b tu blangs pa dang 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong ma la gos blangs pa bdag gi lag tu ni ma blangs kyi khyer te 'ongs pa la bdag gi mig gis mthong bar bzhag ste blangs pa yang lag @98b tu blangs pa dang 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If a monk receives robe-cloth from a nun, but does not receive it with his own hand, but rather has it brought to him, and he receives it while looking at it, then it is as if he received it with his own hand and he commits an offense.

original: dge slong ma la gos blangs pa de bdag gi lag nyid du ni ma 'ongs kyi phas 'ong ba la mig gis mthong ba'i tshe ni nyes byas so zhes mkhan po snga mas bshad /

translated: The former preceptor explains that if a monk receives robe-cloth from a nun, but does not receive it with his own hand, but rather has it brought to him, and he receives it while looking at it, then it is as if he received it with his own hand and he commits an offense.

original: sbyor ba ni mi nye ba la khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni mi nye ba la khas blangs pa'o //
translated: The application is to accept it without being near.

original: dge slong ma la dge slong phas gos blangs pa dang gos mi de la yod kyis khyer cig ces zer ram yul 'di na yod kyi blangs te sbyin no zhes zer na de'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong ma la dge slong phas gos blangs pa dang gos mi de la yod kyis khyer cig ces zer ram yul 'di na yod kyi blangs te sbyin no zhes zer na de'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If a monk receives robe-cloth from a nun, and he says to a man, ‚ÄúThe robe-cloth is with me. Bring it,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe robe-cloth is in this place. I will receive it and give it to you,‚Äù then at that time he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi 'jigs pa la 'dus pa'i dbang gis ma yin pa'i gos sbyin pa la sogs gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa la 'dus pa'i dbang gis ma yin pa'i gos sbyin pa la sogs gtso bo'o //
translated: The main part is giving cloth to a nun, not through the power of a gathering, but through fear.

original: dge slong mas gos sbyin na mo'i sems la mi sbyin pa'am 'gyod pa yod de sems 'jug cing 'jigs pa dang khe dang len 'dod pa lta bur sems 'dus pa'i dbang yin par shes pa ni gos blangs na nyes par 'gyur te de lta bu med pas gos
analyzed: dge slong mas gos sbyin na mo'i sems la mi sbyin pa'am 'gyod pa yod de sems 'jug cing 'jigs pa dang khe dang len 'dod pa lta bur sems 'dus pa'i dbang yin par shes pa ni gos blangs na nyes par 'gyur te de lta bu med pas gos
translated: If a nun gives cloth, but her mind is not to give, or she has regret, or her mind is distracted, or she is afraid, or she wants to get a profit, or she wants to receive something in return, then if one takes the cloth, one incurs an offense.

original: byin pa blangs pa na nyes med do //
analyzed: byin pa blangs pa na nyes med do //
translated: If there is no such thing, then there is no offense in taking the cloth that was given.

original: khyim pa'am gzhan zhig la 'di lta bu'i sems yod de blangs na 'ang bu lon du 'gyur te mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'am gzhan zhig la 'di lta bu'i sems yod de blangs na 'ang bu lon du 'gyur te mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If a layperson or someone else has a mind like this, ‚ÄúIf I take it, it will become a debt,‚Äù then it is called ‚Äúimpure.‚Äù

original: ltung ba med pa ni re zhig gi dus su sems kyis so //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni re zhig gi dus su sems kyis so //
translated: There is no offense if one takes it with the thought, ‚ÄúFor the time being.‚Äù

original: bdag la gos med de re zhig dge slong ma las brnyas te gyon pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: bdag la gos med de re zhig dge slong ma las brnyas te gyon pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúI have no cloth. For the time being, I will borrow it from the nun,‚Äù there is no offense.

original: brjed de rin ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: brjed de rin ma byin pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one forgets and does not pay the price.

original: dge slong ma las gos bzang ngan brjes te ngan pa'i mkhan ma phyis sbyin par byas pa las brjed de ma byin pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma las gos bzang ngan brjes te ngan pa'i mkhan ma phyis sbyin par byas pa las brjed de ma byin pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one exchanges good or bad cloth with a nun, and later one forgets to give the extra price, there is no offense.

original: nam dran pa na sbyin no //
analyzed: nam dran pa na sbyin no //
translated: When one remembers, one should give it.

original: khyim mi 'am gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa brjed na 'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: khyim mi 'am gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa brjed na 'ang nyes med do //
translated: If one forgets a debt to a family member or another, there is no fault.

original: len pa'i spang ba ste 'dul ba dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: len pa'i spang ba ste 'dul ba dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The training rule on receiving, from the chapter on questions on the vinaya.

original: // / len pa'i spang ba pa'o //
analyzed: // / len pa'i spang ba pa'o //
translated: The training rule on receiving.

original: len pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: len pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The training rule on receiving, from the chapter on individual liberation in the vinaya.

original: // / slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa /
analyzed: // / slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa /
translated: The training rule on begging is explained as follows: belonging to the human continuum,üîΩexcept for the four paths, belonging to the human continuum,

original: lam rgyud bzhi ma gtogs par mi'i rgyud gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa /
analyzed: lam rgyud bzhi ma gtogs par mi'i rgyud gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa /
translated: being a layperson,üîΩalso being a layperson, that living being being a layperson, that living being being alive, not being a relative, that layperson not being a relative,

original: khyim pa'ang yin pa dang / srog chags khyim pa yin pa de 'tsho zhing srog dang ldan pa dang gnyen ma yin pa khyim pa de gnyen yang ma yin pa dang / ltung byed yan lag ni lnga dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim pa'ang yin pa dang / srog chags khyim pa yin pa de 'tsho zhing srog dang ldan pa dang gnyen ma yin pa khyim pa de gnyen yang ma yin pa dang / ltung byed yan lag ni lnga dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if one possesses five limbs, it becomes a downfall.

original: de ma thag pa'i gsum po'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i gsum po'o //
translated: The three immediately preceding.

original: lhag ma dang rin thang so so ba gsum yang mdo ltag ma las 'byung ba yan lag bzhi dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbrkus pa dang gos rkun pos @99a * //
analyzed: lhag ma dang rin thang so so ba gsum yang mdo ltag ma las 'byung ba yan lag bzhi dang ldan na spang bar 'gyur ro // brkus pa dang gos rkun pos @99a * //
translated: The three remaining and separately valued articles are also mentioned in the same sutra.

original: khyer ba dang / rlag pa dang gos rlag ste 'khyam pa dang / tshig pa dang / gos mes tshig pa dang / phrogs pa dang gos rlung gis phrogs pa ste khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba ma yin pa'i gos so //
analyzed: khyer ba dang / rlag pa dang gos rlag ste 'khyam pa dang / tshig pa dang / gos mes tshig pa dang / phrogs pa dang gos rlung gis phrogs pa ste khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba ma yin pa'i gos so //
translated: The articles that are stolen, or carried off by thieves, or lost, or worn out, or burned, or blown away by the wind, or carried away by water, are not clothes.

original: gos chus khyer ba dang rkyen ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang byung yang rung ste gcig byung na gos slong du dbang ngo //
analyzed: gos chus khyer ba dang rkyen ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang byung yang rung ste gcig byung na gos slong du dbang ngo //
translated: If any of these conditions, mentioned by name, occur, one may request a robe.

original: rkyen 'di lnga gag kyang rung med na ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen 'di lnga gag kyang rung med na ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If none of these five conditions is present, there is an offense.

original: 'di la yan lag gcig tu brtsis la ltag tu yan lag bzhi'i steng du 'dis bsnan /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag gcig tu brtsis la ltag tu yan lag bzhi'i steng du 'dis bsnan /
translated: In this case, one of the conditions is counted as one part, and the other four are added to the previous four parts.

original: slong ba ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: Requesting is a minor offense.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one requests a robe from a nun who is not a relative, it is a minor offense.

original: thob na rtsa ba'o //üîΩgnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos bslangs te thob na ltung ba yin te yan lag gcig gos so //
analyzed: thob na rtsa ba'o // gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos bslangs te thob na ltung ba yin te yan lag gcig gos so //
translated: If one obtains it, it is the root.üîΩIf one asks a nun who is not a relative for cloth and obtains it, it is a downfall. One part is the cloth.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la bslangs te thob pa de gos yin na dang yan lag gnyis /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la bslangs te thob pa de gos yin na dang yan lag gnyis /
translated: If one asks a nun who is not a relative and obtains cloth, it is a downfall. Two parts are the cloth and the nun.

original: ma bri na'o //
analyzed: ma bri na'o //
translated: If it is not cut.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos bslangs te thob pa de khru gang yan chad kyang yin pa dang / yan lag 'di gsum gyis gong ma lnga'i thog tu bsnan te tshad na spang /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos bslangs te thob pa de khru gang yan chad kyang yin pa dang / yan lag 'di gsum gyis gong ma lnga'i thog tu bsnan te tshad na spang /
translated: If one asks a nun who is not a relative for cloth and obtains it, it is a downfall. Three parts are the cloth, the nun, and the measure of one cubit or more.

original: rnam pa gang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bzhin du bslangs te thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bzhin du bslangs te thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one asks for any of the types mentioned by name and obtains it, it is a downfall.

original: rin dang 'di tsam ri ba zhig bslangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob pa dang / kha dog dang kha dog ser po'am dmar po zhig bsangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob pa dang / khru bslangs na'o //
analyzed: rin dang 'di tsam ri ba zhig bslangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob pa dang / kha dog dang kha dog ser po'am dmar po zhig bsangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob pa dang / khru bslangs na'o //
translated: If one asks for a certain price and obtains that amount, or if one asks for a certain color, such as yellow or red, and obtains that color, or if one asks for a certain measure, it is a downfall.

original: khru tshad mtho tshad 'di tsam zhig bslangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khru tshad mtho tshad 'di tsam zhig bslangs zhes byas te de bzhin thob na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúBuild a hut this high,‚Äù and one gets one, then there is an actual downfall.

original: ltung ba med pa ni gzhan no //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni gzhan no //
translated: There is no downfall if it is different from that.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar tshad dang kha dog ming gis bsngos te bslangs pa las de bas lhag pa'am chung ba zhig byin na ltung bar mi 'gyur te nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar tshad dang kha dog ming gis bsngos te bslangs pa las de bas lhag pa'am chung ba zhig byin na ltung bar mi 'gyur te nyes byas so //
translated: If one asks for cloth of a certain size, color, or name, but is given cloth that is larger or smaller than that, there is no downfall, but an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bsngos te bslangs pa las nor gzhan zhig byin pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: bsngos te bslangs pa las nor gzhan zhig byin pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one asks for a certain kind of cloth, but is given a different kind, there is no fault.

original: lhan pa dang skud pa bslangs pa yang ngo //

translated: The same applies to blue, dark blue, and purple.üîΩIf a monk makes a new mat using black wool that is black by nature, it is a downfall that must be relinquished.

original: lug gi bal rigs kyis nag por 'dug pa la stan sar pa byas na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du ming gis smos pa 'di rnams rigs kyis de ltar 'dug pa la stan sar pa byas nas 'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: lug gi bal rigs kyis nag por 'dug pa la stan sar pa byas na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du ming gis smos pa 'di rnams rigs kyis de ltar 'dug pa la stan sar pa byas nas 'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: The same applies to the wool of the animals mentioned by name, if it is black by nature.

original: yul la la zhig na dkar po dkon na yang bal dkar bo 'ba' zhig la stan sar pa byas na'ang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la la zhig na dkar po dkon na yang bal dkar bo 'ba' zhig la stan sar pa byas na'ang spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In some places, even though white wool is rare, if one makes a new mat only of white wool, it becomes a downfall.

original: yan lag dang bshad pa kun srin bu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang bshad pa kun srin bu dang 'dra'o //
translated: The parts and the explanation are all like insects.

original: nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'o //üîΩ'ba' zhig pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'o // 'ba' zhig pa'i spang ba'i ltung ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: This is the downfall of using only black wool.üîΩThis is the downfall of using only black wool, as it appears in the Vinaya Verses.

original: // / cha'i spang ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / cha'i spang ba la 'chad de /
translated: The Vinaya experts explain that this refers to a downfall of using a mat.

original: de dag phyed las lhag na'o //
analyzed: de dag phyed las lhag na'o //
translated: If one uses more than half,

original: dge slong lug bal la stan sar ba byed na phyed lug bal nag po las gzhug / bzhi cha gcig dkar po las gzhug / bzhi cha gcig shog bal las gzhug ste de las nag po dang dkar po lhag na spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong lug bal la stan sar ba byed na phyed lug bal nag po las gzhug / bzhi cha gcig dkar po las gzhug / bzhi cha gcig shog bal las gzhug ste de las nag po dang dkar po lhag na spang bar 'gyur /
translated: if a monk makes a new mat of sheep wool, he must use more than half black sheep wool, one quarter white wool, and one quarter cotton. If he uses more black and white wool, it becomes a downfall.

original: shog bal lhag par bcug pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: shog bal lhag par bcug pa ni nyes med do //
translated: Using more cotton is not a downfall.

original: 'di dkar po dang shog bal du cha mnyam par bsre'o //
analyzed: 'di dkar po dang shog bal du cha mnyam par bsre'o //
translated: One should mix the white and cotton equally.

original: lug gi bal stan sar pa byed na phyed nag po las gzhug / phyed dkar po dang shog bal las gzhug ste nag po la bzhi cha gnyis dkar po la bzhi cha gcig / shog bal yang bzhi cha gcig gis thang du bcug @103a * //
analyzed: lug gi bal stan sar pa byed na phyed nag po las gzhug / phyed dkar po dang shog bal las gzhug ste nag po la bzhi cha gnyis dkar po la bzhi cha gcig / shog bal yang bzhi cha gcig gis thang du bcug @103a * //
translated: One should use two quarters of black, one quarter of white, and one quarter of cotton wool.

original: ste bya'o // logs dang rgyab dang gnya' ba nas skyes pa ni snga ma'i 'o //
analyzed: ste bya'o // logs dang rgyab dang gnya' ba nas skyes pa ni snga ma'i 'o //
translated: The wool from the sides, back and neck is as before.

original: lug gi rtsib logs dang rgyab dang / gnya' ba nas bal ba ni 'jam bal yin te dkar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lug gi rtsib logs dang rgyab dang / gnya' ba nas bal ba ni 'jam bal yin te dkar po zhes bya'o //
translated: The wool from the sides, back and neck of a sheep is soft wool, called white.

original: mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba'i ni phyi ma'i 'o //
analyzed: mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba'i ni phyi ma'i 'o //
translated: The wool from the head, legs and belly is as follows.

original: lug gi mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba nas bal ba ni shog bal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lug gi mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba nas bal ba ni shog bal zhes bya ste /
translated: The wool from the head, legs and belly of a sheep is called cotton wool.

original: 'di rnams la gong du bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du bsre'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la gong du bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du bsre'o //
translated: These should be mixed in the manner explained above.

original: yan lag dang bshad pa ni kun rtag tu srin bu dang 'ba' zhig ba 'chad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang bshad pa ni kun rtag tu srin bu dang 'ba' zhig ba 'chad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The limbs and explanations are always like the explanation of the mere worm.

original: cha gnyis kyi spang ba'o //
analyzed: cha gnyis kyi spang ba'o //
translated: This is the rejection of two parts.

original: cha 'di spang ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: cha 'di spang ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: This is explained in the Vinaya Divisions as the relinquishment of the six.

original: // / drug gi spang ba la 'chad de /üîΩchu dang zheng dang lhag pa bcad do //
analyzed: // / drug gi spang ba la 'chad de / chu dang zheng dang lhag pa bcad do //
translated: The relinquishment of the six is explained as follows.

original: dge slong gis gding ba lo drug tu lon pa zhig rnyings te spyad du mi rung nas dge 'dun la spyad brim du 'ongs nas sar ba byed du gsol na dge 'dun gyis ltos la rnying pa spyad du mi rung na sar pa byed du chug shig /
analyzed: dge slong gis gding ba lo drug tu lon pa zhig rnyings te spyad du mi rung nas dge 'dun la spyad brim du 'ongs nas sar ba byed du gsol na dge 'dun gyis ltos la rnying pa spyad du mi rung na sar pa byed du chug shig /
translated: If a monk has used a mat for six years and it is worn out and unfit to use, he may offer it to the sa·πÖgha and request that it be cut up. The sa·πÖgha should examine it. If it is worn out and unfit to use, it should be cut up.

original: sar pa de chu zheng du lhag na tshad bzhin las lhag pa chod du chug cig / thung ngam chung na skyed do //
analyzed: sar pa de chu zheng du lhag na tshad bzhin las lhag pa chod du chug cig / thung ngam chung na skyed do //
translated: If the new mat is larger in width or length, it should be cut to the right size. If it is shorter or smaller, it should be extended.

original: gding ba de chung ngam thung na ltag tu srin bu'i nang du tshad che chung rnam gnyis bshad pa gang yang rung gag gi tshad du dga' bar skyed cig chad na sbyar ro //
analyzed: gding ba de chung ngam thung na ltag tu srin bu'i nang du tshad che chung rnam gnyis bshad pa gang yang rung gag gi tshad du dga' bar skyed cig chad na sbyar ro //
translated: If the mat is small or short, it should be extended to the size of the two measurements of the width and length of the mat that are explained in the interior of the insect.üîΩIf it is cut, it should be sewn.

original: gding ba rnying pa chad pa zhig ste slar sbyar na spyad du rung na sar pa byed par gnang ba mi sbyin par chad pa 'di ltar sbyor te tshems la spyod cig ces bsgo shig gyes sam srab na kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa chad pa zhig ste slar sbyar na spyad du rung na sar pa byed par gnang ba mi sbyin par chad pa 'di ltar sbyor te tshems la spyod cig ces bsgo shig gyes sam srab na kha bskang ngo //
translated: If the old sitting mat is torn and can be used again if sewn, then one should not give permission to make a new one. One should tell him, ‚ÄúYou should use this one.‚Äù

original: gding ba rnying pa de gyes sam srab mor song ste glan nam spyad du rung ba tsam gyi tshod na'ang sar pa byed par gnang ba mi sbyin par rnying pa lhan pas glon la slar sbyor du chug shig / dka' bar byed na sbyin no //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa de gyes sam srab mor song ste glan nam spyad du rung ba tsam gyi tshod na'ang sar pa byed par gnang ba mi sbyin par rnying pa lhan pas glon la slar sbyor du chug shig / dka' bar byed na sbyin no //
translated: If the old sitting mat is torn or worn thin, and if it is the right size to be patched or used as a mat, then one should not give permission to make a new one. One should tell him, ‚ÄúYou should patch the old one and use it again.‚ÄùüîΩIf it is difficult to use, then one should give permission.

original: gding ba rnying pa de rnyings ches te glan kyang spyad du mi rung na stan sar pa byed par dge 'dun gyis gnang ba byin cig / gnang ba ma thob la /
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa de rnyings ches te glan kyang spyad du mi rung na stan sar pa byed par dge 'dun gyis gnang ba byin cig / gnang ba ma thob la /
translated: If the old sitting mat is so worn out that it cannot be used even if patched, then the Sa·πÖgha should give permission to make a new sitting mat.üîΩIf a monk makes a new sitting mat without having received permission from the Sa·πÖgha,

original: dge slong gis stan lo drug pa sar pa zhig byas na dge 'dun lam gsol tam gsol kyang gnang ba ma thob pa dang / gzhan yod dam /
analyzed: dge slong gis stan lo drug pa sar pa zhig byas na dge 'dun lam gsol tam gsol kyang gnang ba ma thob pa dang / gzhan yod dam /
translated: or if he makes a new sitting mat before six years have passed since the old one was made,üîΩor if he makes a new sitting mat without having asked the Sa·πÖgha for permission,üîΩor if he makes a new sitting mat even though he has other sitting mats,

original: stan lo drug pa snga ma yod bzhin du phyi ma gsar du byas pa dang / bdag gis 'dod de btang ngam bdag stan sar pa 'dod pa'i phyir rnying pa gud du btang ste sar pa byas pa dang / lo drug gi rgyud ma 'das par /
analyzed: stan lo drug pa snga ma yod bzhin du phyi ma gsar du byas pa dang / bdag gis 'dod de btang ngam bdag stan sar pa 'dod pa'i phyir rnying pa gud du btang ste sar pa byas pa dang / lo drug gi rgyud ma 'das par /
translated: The new one is made while the old one still exists, and either one gives away the old one because one desires to, or one gives away the old one separately because one desires a new mat.

original: gding ba @103b rnying pa lo drug ma lon par sar pa byas pa dang / gding ba byed na'o //
analyzed: gding ba @103b rnying pa lo drug ma lon par sar pa byas pa dang / gding ba byed na'o //
translated: The old mat is not made new before six years have passed.

original: yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan par gding ba sar pa byas te zin na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan par gding ba sar pa byas te zin na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one makes a new mat while possessing these parts, then one commits a downfall.

original: yod bzhin du brtsams shing bshams na yang ngo //
analyzed: yod bzhin du brtsams shing bshams na yang ngo //
translated: If one begins and prepares a new mat while one already has one, then also.

original: stan sar pa gcig bya bar brtsams shing bshams te mgo btsugs pa la zin par phyi ma gcig kyang bya bar mgo btsugs te bshams na nyes so //üîΩbshams te mthar byin na sbyor ba ma lus ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: stan sar pa gcig bya bar brtsams shing bshams te mgo btsugs pa la zin par phyi ma gcig kyang bya bar mgo btsugs te bshams na nyes so //üîΩbshams te mthar byin na sbyor ba ma lus ltung ba yin no //
translated: If one begins and prepares one new mat, and also begins and prepares another new mat before the first is finished, then there is an infraction.üîΩIf one begins and prepares one new mat, and then gives it away before the first is finished, then the preparation is a downfall.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar stan rnam gnyis bya bar mgo btsugs pa las snga ma ni ma zin gyi phyi ma zin na nyes byas so //üîΩsnga ma dang gnyis zin na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar stan rnam gnyis bya bar mgo btsugs pa las snga ma ni ma zin gyi phyi ma zin na nyes byas so // snga ma dang gnyis zin na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one begins to make two mats, as in the case of the upper robe, there is an offense of wrong conduct if one finishes the first but not the second.üîΩIf one finishes both, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: spang ba ni phyis mgo btsugs shing bshams pa las sngar zin pa de spang ngo //
analyzed: spang ba ni phyis mgo btsugs shing bshams pa las sngar zin pa de spang ngo //
translated: The relinquishment is that one relinquishes the one that was finished first, and then begins and finishes the second.

original: rab tu 'byung ba gzhan gyis tha dad do //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba gzhan gyis tha dad do //
translated: Ordination is different.

original: sngon dge slong byed byed pa las slar khrims phul ba las yang slar khrims nos te gding ba sar pa byas pa ni sngon dge slong byed pa'i tshe gding ba byas su zin kyang gding ba gnyis byas par mi brtsi'o //üîΩlo drug gi spang ba'o //
analyzed: sngon dge slong byed byed pa las slar khrims phul ba las yang slar khrims nos te gding ba sar pa byas pa ni sngon dge slong byed pa'i tshe gding ba byas su zin kyang gding ba gnyis byas par mi brtsi'o // lo drug gi spang ba'o //
translated: If one who has previously been a monk and then returned his vows later takes the vows again and makes a new mat, even though he may have already made a mat when he was a monk, it is not counted as making two mats.üîΩThe relinquishment of the six-year rule.

original: drug gi spang ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: drug gi spang ba ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The summary verse from the Vinaya Divisions states:

original: // / mtho gang gi spang ba la 'chad de gding ba rnying pas sar pa'i gding ba la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ma glan par spyad na'o //üîΩbdag gi gding ba bsngos pa rnyings te sar pa byed na rnying pa dbus ni zad cing rtol gyis mtha' mkho ra khor yug tu ma rtol ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang 'khor bar dra ste gru bzhir sbyar la sar pa sra bar bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: // / mtho gang gi spang ba la 'chad de gding ba rnying pas sar pa'i gding ba la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang ma glan par spyad na'o // bdag gi gding ba bsngos pa rnyings te sar pa byed na rnying pa dbus ni zad cing rtol gyis mtha' mkho ra khor yug tu ma rtol ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang 'khor bar dra ste gru bzhir sbyar la sar pa sra bar bya ba'i phyir
translated: If one uses a new mat without adding a span of the Tathagata to the old mat, it is a downfall.üîΩ If one makes a new mat because the old one is worn out, and if the old one is worn out in the middle, and not worn out at the edges, one should cut off the worn out part, and add the new mat to the edges, and sew it on all around.

original: sar pa'i dbus su glon cig / rnying pa yod bzhin du sar pa byas te rnying pa'i mtha' las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan par byas te spyad na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //üîΩde ste yod na'o //üîΩgding ba rnying pa yod na sar pa'i dbus su glan gyi rnying pa med na ma glan pa sar pa byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: sar pa'i dbus su glon cig / rnying pa yod bzhin du sar pa byas te rnying pa'i mtha' las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan par byas te spyad na spang ba'i ltung ba'o // de ste yod na'o // gding ba rnying pa yod na sar pa'i dbus su glan gyi rnying pa med na ma glan pa sar pa byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one makes a new mat without adding a span of the Tathagata to the old mat, it is a downfall.

original: de tsam na yang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam na yang ngo //
translated: If one has the old mat, one should add the new mat to the middle of the old one. If one does not have the old mat, there is no downfall if one makes a new mat without adding the new mat to the old one.üîΩ If one makes a new mat without adding the new mat to the old one, it is a downfall.

original: gding ba rnying pa yod ni yod de mtha' las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang du mi 'byung na yang ci yod pa des glan no //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa yod ni yod de mtha' las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang du mi 'byung na yang ci yod pa des glan no //
translated: If there is an old sitting mat, but it is not comfortable because it is less than a handspan of the Sugata in size, then one should add to it.

original: bcos nus na yang ngo //üîΩgding ba rnying pa rnyings te btang nas bsdus shing btsems la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang 'byung na 'ang bsdus shing btsems la bde bar gshegs @104a * //
analyzed: bcos nus na yang ngo // gding ba rnying pa rnyings te btang nas bsdus shing btsems la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang 'byung na 'ang bsdus shing btsems la bde bar gshegs @104a * //
translated: If it can be repaired, then also.üîΩIf the old sitting mat is worn out, then after discarding it, one should gather the pieces, sew them together, and add to it a handspan of the Sugata.

original: pa'i mtho gang du kha bskang la /
analyzed: pa'i mtho gang du kha bskang la /
translated: After gathering the pieces, one should sew them together and add to it a handspan of the Sugata.

original: gding ba sar pa'i dbus su glan /
analyzed: gding ba sar pa'i dbus su glan /
translated: One should add it to the center of the new sitting mat.

original: dum bu bsdus te yang ngo //
analyzed: dum bu bsdus te yang ngo //
translated: If the pieces are gathered, then also.

original: gding ba rnying pa dum bur so sor bral ba zhig na yang dum bu kun mi dor bsdus pa gcig la gcig btsems te sar pa'i dbus su glan /
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa dum bur so sor bral ba zhig na yang dum bu kun mi dor bsdus pa gcig la gcig btsems te sar pa'i dbus su glan /
translated: If the old sitting mat is separated into pieces, then one should not discard all the pieces. One should gather them together, sew them together, and add them to the center of the new sitting mat.

original: mtho gang gi spang ba'o //üîΩmtho gang gi spang ba 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: mtho gang gi spang ba'o // mtho gang gi spang ba 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: This is the avoidance of a handspan.üîΩThe avoidance of a handspan is explained in the Vinaya in the section on the summary.

original: // / lam gyi spang ba la 'chad de //
analyzed: // / lam gyi spang ba la 'chad de //
translated: The avoidance of the road is explained in the Vinaya in the section on the summary.

original: khur tsa yod dam med kyang dpag tshad gsum las 'das par lug bal khyer na'o //
analyzed: khur tsa yod dam med kyang dpag tshad gsum las 'das par lug bal khyer na'o //
translated: If one carries wool more than three krosas, even if one has no load, except if one carries it for a bhikshuni.

original: dge slong gis bal zhig rnyed de khur tsa yod bzhin du bdag gis blangs te khyer na thog ma khyer ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong gis bal zhig rnyed de khur tsa yod bzhin du bdag gis blangs te khyer na thog ma khyer ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If a bhikshu finds some wool and carries it, thinking, ‚ÄúI will take it,‚Äù then at the beginning of the carrying, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags phyed du phyin na'ang nyes byas gcig / dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags gcig 'das na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If one goes three krosas and a half a krosa, there is one offense of wrong conduct. If one goes three krosas and one krosa, there is a downfall of abandonment.

original: lam du zhugs nas rgyang grags nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lam du zhugs nas rgyang grags nyid kyis so //
translated: If one goes by the road, it is by the krosa.

original: khur tsa yod bzhin du bal khyer na dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags gcig 'das pas spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khur tsa yod bzhin du bal khyer na dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags gcig 'das pas spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one carries wool while having a load, one abandons it by going three krosas and one krosa.

original: bud med dang / dge slong ma dang lam du 'grogs pa yang rgyang grags gcig 'das na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang / dge slong ma dang lam du 'grogs pa yang rgyang grags gcig 'das na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one travels on the road with a woman or a bhikshuni, there is an offense if one goes a krosa.

original: yang yang gis lam dus kyang rgyang grags gcig 'das na bzar dbang ngo ;
analyzed: yang yang gis lam dus kyang rgyang grags gcig 'das na bzar dbang ngo ;
translated: If one goes a krosa by going back and forth on the road, one abandons it.

original: / phyed ni sbyor ba'i 'o //
analyzed: / phyed ni sbyor ba'i 'o //
translated: Half is the preparation.

original: khur tsa yod bzhin du bal dag khyer te dpag tshad dang rgyang grags phyed 'das na nyes byas so //
analyzed: khur tsa yod bzhin du bal dag khyer te dpag tshad dang rgyang grags phyed 'das na nyes byas so //
translated: If one carries wool while having a load, one commits an offense after passing one kro≈õa or half a gƒÅvuta.

original: bud med dang dge slong ma dang lam du 'grogs pa yang rgyang grags phyed du 'das na nyes byas /
analyzed: bud med dang dge slong ma dang lam du 'grogs pa yang rgyang grags phyed du 'das na nyes byas /
translated: Also, if one travels on the road with a woman or a fully ordained nun, one commits an offense after passing half a gƒÅvuta.

original: nyes byas pa ni rdzu 'phrul las gzhan gyi thabs kyis nam mkha' las blangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni rdzu 'phrul las gzhan gyi thabs kyis nam mkha' las blangs pa'o //
translated: The offense is taking wool through the sky by means other than supernormal power.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'phrul gyis bal khyer pa ni ma gtogs te 'jig rten gyi rdzu 'phrul gyis bal khyer ba dang sgyogs la sogs pa lta bus nam mkha' la 'phangs te bal khyer ba ni dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags gcig 'das na nyes byas gcig / de
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'phrul gyis bal khyer pa ni ma gtogs te 'jig rten gyi rdzu 'phrul gyis bal khyer ba dang sgyogs la sogs pa lta bus nam mkha' la 'phangs te bal khyer ba ni dpag tshad gsum dang rgyang grags gcig 'das na nyes byas gcig / de
translated: Except for taking wool by the supernormal power of an arhat, taking wool by worldly supernormal power, or throwing it into the sky with a catapult and so on, if one passes three kro≈õas and one gƒÅvuta, one commits one offense.

original: phan chad rgyang grags re re 'das shing nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: phan chad rgyang grags re re 'das shing nyes byas re re'o //
translated: After that, one offense is committed for each kro≈õa that is passed.

original: sprul bas kyang ngo //

analyzed: sa bon gyi chos ma yin pa nyes pa mi byed do //

translated: Until they become non-seeds, do not count the examinations. As mentioned in the above s≈´tra, if they have already been examined before, or if they are damaged, wounded, and so forth, and are unsuitable as seeds, they have already been examined, and there is no need to examine them again.

original: rlangs pa me ma @124a * //
analyzed: rlangs pa me ma @124a * //

analyzed: yin no // sa bon la sogs pa rlangs pa tsha ba la gdungs shing reg pa yang mes brtags pa'i nang du chud de phyis brtags mi dgos so //

analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa na mes 'bras bu'i spyi'i gzugs su brtags pa gtso bor byas pa'o //

analyzed: nas dang shing tog la sogs pa lta bu mang zhig phung por 'dug pa la brtags pa ni 'bru re re nas brtags mi dgos kyi phung po'i spyir mes reg par byugs pas chog go //
translated: When many things such as barley and fruit are placed together in a heap, it is not necessary to examine each grain, but it is sufficient to touch the heap with fire.

analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig tu na 'dus pa'i mi 'gyur mi ldang ngo //

translated: It is not sufficient to touch one side of the heap with fire, but it is examined by merely touching it with fire on all sides.

original: dge slong gis byas pa yang brtags pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis byas pa yang brtags pa byas pa'o //

original: sa ma brtags par yang ngo //
analyzed: sa ma brtags par yang ngo //

analyzed: mes brtags pa ni dge slong gi gnas su g-yos sos pa dang 'dra'o //

translated: When eating the seven-day medicine, molasses, honey, butter, vegetable oil, and so on, and the lifetime medicine, and so on, one should make another person sprinkle it with cold water and examine it.

analyzed: ma brtags par zos sam bdag gis brtags na nyes byas /

analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis dag la byed de /

original: rtsa ba'i ni bgrang bar ro //

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba'i tshad ni dge 'dun gyis de skad ma zer cig ces bsgo bal ma btang ste dge 'dun gyis khyed tshul khrims dang mi ldan zhing log par spyod pa yin te tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa'i nang du gtogs so zhes bsgos te ma btang

original: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //

original: yan lag 'di lnga dang ldan na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag 'di lnga dang ldan na ltung ba'o //

original: gzhan du na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyes byas pa'o //

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dge 'dun gyis mi bsgo zhing ma bgrangs kyi bar du phyar cing smras pa dang 'phyar par ma bsams par 'phyar ba'i tshig tu kha nas byung ba nyes byas /

translated: If I hold a grudge against him, I will not be appointed to any work.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis kyis las su bskos pa gang yang rung ste /üîΩdge slong gzhan @125a * //
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis kyis las su bskos pa gang yang rung ste / dge slong gzhan @125a * //

translated: Because the Sa·πÖgha is wealthy and the individual is poor and destitute.üîΩAfter removing them, place a monk who is unable to work as a guard.

analyzed: der sngas sam 'phongs su byas na byas pa'o //

analyzed: dgon par bting ba las ma brtul na nyes byas so //

analyzed: mdor na dor ba dag dor te byar mi rung bar ma gyur pa dag go //

original: gzhan du na dus dus su brtag / rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa bting zhing spyod pa ma rul zhing spyad du rung ba ni srin bu zhugs sam ma zhugs dus dus su brtag cing blta'o //

original: brje ba'i yang ngo //
analyzed: brje ba'i yang ngo //

analyzed: la btags te bzhag / de ltar shing la btags pa ni mi 'drul ba dang srin bu mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

translated: If one leaves without doing that,

analyzed: gzhan gding du bcug pa las ma brtul na ltung bar 'gyur ro //

original: gding ba'i @131a * //

original: // / skrod pa la 'chad de /

translated: expels or causes another monk to be expelled from the temple of the community of monks. If he does so out of anger and spite, he incurs a downfall, even if he does not act on his intention.üîΩIf, however, the monk is expelled because he is a source of harm to the community,

analyzed: khang pa rdib tu 'ong ba dang chu dang me la sogs pa dbyung ba'i phyir gnas spos pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa 'byung ste /

analyzed: ma phyung na dge 'dun 'khrug pa mi zhi ba'i phyir phyung ba dang / byed par 'dod na ma yin no //

analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas kyang dge slong phyung na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / gzhan gyis kyang ngo //

translated: If a fully ordained monk is expelled by a female probationer, a female novice, or a male novice, then the monk is expelled. But if it is a male novice, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang ngo //

original: dge slob ma dang dge sbyong ma dang dge sbyong bskrad na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slob ma dang dge sbyong ma dang dge sbyong bskrad na nyes byas so //

original: rtsed mo na yang ngo //
analyzed: rtsed mo na yang ngo //

analyzed: snying nas bskrad pa ni ma yin gyi rtsed mo'i phyir bskrad pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not done with a sincere mind, but is done in jest, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khyim mi na bsod nams ma yin pa mang ngo //
analyzed: khyim mi na bsod nams ma yin pa mang ngo //
translated: If a householder is sick, there is much demerit.

original: khyim mi la dge slong skrod du bcol na dge slong ni ltung ba khyim pa la ni ltung ba'i rim pa med de sdig che'o //
analyzed: khyim mi la dge slong skrod du bcol na dge slong ni ltung ba khyim pa la ni ltung ba'i rim pa med de sdig che'o //
translated: If a householder asks a fully ordained monk to expel a fully ordained monk, then the fully ordained monk is expelled. But if it is a householder, there is no stage of downfall, but great sin.

original: bskrad pa'o // bskrad pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /
analyzed: bskrad pa'o // bskrad pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /

original: // / phyis gnon gyi ltung ba la 'chad de /

original: skom gyi phyir gsol na 'dug shig / grong bar du mchod ston la spyan drangs pa las zan zos zin na don med par ring du mi 'khod de sbyin bdag na re phyi phred rgun chab la sogs pa gsol te gshegs zhes zer ba las bsdad pa dang
analyzed: skom gyi phyir gsol na 'dug shig / grong bar du mchod ston la spyan drangs pa las zan zos zin na don med par ring du mi 'khod de sbyin bdag na re phyi phred rgun chab la sogs pa gsol te gshegs zhes zer ba las bsdad pa dang
translated: If invited to a meal in a village, if one has already eaten, one should not stay for long without purpose. If the patron says, ‚ÄúDrink grape wine and so on and then leave,‚Äù one may stay.

original: btung pa la nyes med /
analyzed: btung pa la nyes med /
translated: There is no fault in drinking.

original: mnyam du 'am phyi nas gos kyi rnyed pa dang mi ldan bar gnyis po'i spyan 'dren pa thob na'o //
analyzed: mnyam du 'am phyi nas gos kyi rnyed pa dang mi ldan bar gnyis po'i spyan 'dren pa thob na'o //
translated: If one obtains an invitation to both, one should go later.

original: yon bdag gnyis shig gis mchod ston la so sor lhan cig tu spyan drangs na gnyis @138a * //üîΩka la 'ong ngo zhes khas blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: yon bdag gnyis shig gis mchod ston la so sor lhan cig tu spyan drangs na gnyis @138a * // ka la 'ong ngo zhes khas blangs na nyes byas /
translated: If two benefactors invite a monk to a meal, and he accepts both invitations, it is a minor infraction.

original: nyin gcig la lnga phyir spyan drangs pa las gnyis ka la khas blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: nyin gcig la lnga phyir spyan drangs pa las gnyis ka la khas blangs na nyes byas /
translated: If he accepts invitations to five meals in one day, it is a minor infraction.

original: spyan 'dren pa da gnyis ka na re gos shig yon du dbul lo zhes zer ba las gnyis ka la khas blangs na zos na nyes pa med /üîΩspyan 'dren pa snga ma la gos yod la spyan 'dren pa phyi ma la gos med par phyi ma'i zan zos pa ni ltung ba'o //
analyzed: spyan 'dren pa da gnyis ka na re gos shig yon du dbul lo zhes zer ba las gnyis ka la khas blangs na zos na nyes pa med / spyan 'dren pa snga ma la gos yod la spyan 'dren pa phyi ma la gos med par phyi ma'i zan zos pa ni ltung ba'o //
translated: If he accepts both invitations, but the first benefactor says, ‚ÄúI will give you a robe as a gift,‚Äù and he accepts the gift, there is no offense in eating the meal.üîΩIf the first benefactor has no robe to give, but the second one does, and the monk accepts the second invitation, he commits an offense.

original: spyan 'dren pa snga ma la gos med la phyi ma la gos yod de khas blangs nas zos pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: spyan 'dren pa snga ma la gos med la phyi ma la gos yod de khas blangs nas zos pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If the first benefactor has no robe to give, but the second one does, and the monk accepts the second invitation, there is no offense.

original: bza' bas so //
analyzed: bza' bas so //
translated: This refers to eating.

original: yang yang bca' bas ni bza' ba las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang yang bca' bas ni bza' ba las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats again and again, he does not commit an offense for each instance.

original: bca' ba ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang tshigs pa dang me tog dang 'bras bu lnga'i nang du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang tshigs pa dang me tog dang 'bras bu lnga'i nang du gtogs pa'o //
translated: The cooked food is included in the five: roots, stalks, joints, flowers, and fruits.

original: bca' ba 'di rnams las lan gnyis zos kyang ltung ba med do //üîΩlnga'i nang du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba 'di rnams las lan gnyis zos kyang ltung ba med do // lnga'i nang du gtogs pa'o //
translated: If one eats two meals of these cooked foods, there is no offense.üîΩThe cooked food is included in the five: roots, stalks, joints, flowers, and fruits.

original: bza' ba ni rnam pa lnga ste 'bras dang khur ba dang sran ma dang phye dang sha dang 'di rnams lnga'i nang du gtogs pa las lan gnyis su zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba ni rnam pa lnga ste 'bras dang khur ba dang sran ma dang phye dang sha dang 'di rnams lnga'i nang du gtogs pa las lan gnyis su zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The food is of five kinds: rice, barley cakes, beans, flour, and meat. If one eats two meals of these five kinds of food, there is an offense.

original: bza' ba lan gcig bca' ba lan gcig snga phyir lan gnyis zos kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba lan gcig bca' ba lan gcig snga phyir lan gnyis zos kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats one meal of food and one meal of cooked food, either before or after, there is no offense.

original: de ste gzhan du'ang 'di na'o //
analyzed: de ste gzhan du'ang 'di na'o //
translated: If it is the other way around, there is an offense.

original: bza' ba rnam lnga las sngar lan gcig zos zin la phyis gzhan zhig gis spyan drangs te bza' ba rnam lnga las zos na ltung /
analyzed: bza' ba rnam lnga las sngar lan gcig zos zin la phyis gzhan zhig gis spyan drangs te bza' ba rnam lnga las zos na ltung /
translated: If one has already eaten one meal of the five kinds of food, and later is invited by someone else and eats the five kinds of food, there is an offense.

original: yon bdag gis bca' ba sbyin pa'i phyir spyan drangs la bca' ba'ang zos bza' ba'ang zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: yon bdag gis bca' ba sbyin pa'i phyir spyan drangs la bca' ba'ang zos bza' ba'ang zos na nyes byas so //
translated: If one is invited by a patron to give cooked food, and one eats the cooked food and the food, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bza' ba la spyan drangs te bza' ba dang bca' ba gnyis snga phyir zos pa nyes med do bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bza' ba la spyan drangs te bza' ba dang bca' ba gnyis snga phyir zos pa nyes med do bar 'gyur /
translated: It is not an offense if one is invited to eat and eats both food and drink, but not in sequence.

original: mi na las ma byas lam du ma zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mi na las ma byas lam du ma zhugs pa'o //
translated: One is not sick, has not done work, and is not traveling.

original: na ba dang las byas pa dang lam du zhugs pa'i rkyen med par zan lan gnyis zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ba dang las byas pa dang lam du zhugs pa'i rkyen med par zan lan gnyis zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats a second meal without these conditions of being sick, having done work, or traveling, one commits an offense.

original: 'di rnams kyi rkyen byung ste zos pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rkyen byung ste zos pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If these conditions occur, there is no offense.

original: dgongs pas ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If one accepts an invitation with the intention of eating, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sngar zan zos zin pa'i 'og tu spyan 'dren pa cig 'ongs pa dang ma zos pa'i mdun du sngar spyan drangs pa gcig la khas blangs pa las phyis gos med pa las 'gro bar bsams shing khas blangs na de'i tshe nyes byas zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: sngar zan zos zin pa'i 'og tu spyan 'dren pa cig 'ongs pa dang ma zos pa'i mdun du sngar spyan drangs pa gcig la khas blangs pa las phyis gos med pa las 'gro bar bsams shing khas blangs na de'i tshe nyes byas zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one accepts an invitation from someone who has already eaten, but then does not eat in front of that person, and later, without any clothing, one thinks of going and accepts the invitation, then at that time one commits an offense of wrong conduct. If one eats, one commits an offense.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar spyan drangs las rnam gnyis su zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar spyan drangs las rnam gnyis su zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one accepts an invitation from someone who has already eaten, and then eats both meals in two separate sittings, one commits an offense.

original: gos de khru gang khor yug gi mthar gyur na'o //
analyzed: gos de khru gang khor yug gi mthar gyur na'o //
translated: If the cloth is one cubit all the way around.

original: gos dang bcas te zos na lan gnyis su @138b zos kyang mi ltung ngo zhes bshad pa'i gos kyi tshad ni khru gang 'khor ba yan chad cig sbyin pa'i phyir zan lan gnyis zos pa ni ltung bar mi 'gyur de las chung ba ni ltung bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: gos dang bcas te zos na lan gnyis su @138b zos kyang mi ltung ngo zhes bshad pa'i gos kyi tshad ni khru gang 'khor ba yan chad cig sbyin pa'i phyir zan lan gnyis zos pa ni ltung bar mi 'gyur de las chung ba ni ltung bar 'gyur ro
translated: If one eats with clothing on, one does not commit an infraction by eating twice, but if one eats less than that, one commits an infraction.

original: // lam ni dpag tshad phyed do //
analyzed: // lam ni dpag tshad phyed do //
translated: The path is half a krosa.

original: lam du zhugs na lan gnyis su zos kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni dpag tshad phyed de rgyang grags bzhir 'gro ba'am phyin na zar dbang ngo //
analyzed: lam du zhugs na lan gnyis su zos kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni dpag tshad phyed de rgyang grags bzhir 'gro ba'am phyin na zar dbang ngo //
translated: If one enters the path, one does not commit an infraction by eating twice, but if one goes or travels four kro≈õas, one commits an infraction.

original: gzhan du yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ngo //
translated: Also, in other places.

original: so sor za ba'i lam la sogs pa dus kyang dpag tshad phyed du 'gro na so sor bzar dbang ste dus su chud de /
analyzed: so sor za ba'i lam la sogs pa dus kyang dpag tshad phyed du 'gro na so sor bzar dbang ste dus su chud de /
translated: If one goes half a krosa on the path of individual consumption and so on, one is able to eat individually, that is, at the proper time.

original: 'di lam grur 'gro ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di lam grur 'gro ba yang ngo //
translated: This also applies to one who travels by vehicle.

original: lam dpag tshad phyed du 'gro ba dus su chud pa ni /
analyzed: lam dpag tshad phyed du 'gro ba dus su chud pa ni /
translated: One who travels half a krosa on the path at the proper time

original: rkang pas 'gro ba dang / grur zhugs pa gnyis ni bzar dbang gi rta dang shing rta la sogs pa la zhon pa ni dpag tshad phyed du phyin kyang dus su mi chud de bzar mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rkang pas 'gro ba dang / grur zhugs pa gnyis ni bzar dbang gi rta dang shing rta la sogs pa la zhon pa ni dpag tshad phyed du phyin kyang dus su mi chud de bzar mi dbang ngo //
translated: Walking on foot and traveling by boat are not included in the time period, but traveling by horse, chariot and so on are included in the time period because one has control over them.

original: phyag dar re lde tsam mam byug pa ba ko tsam ni las so //
analyzed: phyag dar re lde tsam mam byug pa ba ko tsam ni las so //
translated: Sweeping is a karmic act and smearing is a karmic act.

original: las byas na yang yang dbang ba ni re lde tsam gyis phyags pa dang mandal ba'i ko btsam mam ba nyal ba tsam gyi sa phyags pa ni dus su chud de zar dbang ngo //
analyzed: las byas na yang yang dbang ba ni re lde tsam gyis phyags pa dang mandal ba'i ko btsam mam ba nyal ba tsam gyi sa phyags pa ni dus su chud de zar dbang ngo //
translated: If one performs a karmic act, then one has control over it. Sweeping with a broom or smearing with cow dung or smearing with leather or smearing with grass is included in the time period and one has control over it.

original: phyag dar bya ba ni chag chag sngar btab la phyag go //
analyzed: phyag dar bya ba ni chag chag sngar btab la phyag go //
translated: One should sweep after sprinkling water.

original: mandal ni ba lang gi lci ba'am 'jim pa 'jam pos bya'o //
analyzed: mandal ni ba lang gi lci ba'am 'jim pa 'jam pos bya'o //
translated: One should make a mandala with cow dung or smooth clay.

original: de mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi la'o //
analyzed: de mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi la'o //
translated: This is for the sake of the stupa or the Sangha.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar sa phyags pa dang mandal bya ba ni dge 'dun gnas 'dus pa'i gtsug lag khang ngam sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i mchod rten dri gtsang khang du bya'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar sa phyags pa dang mandal bya ba ni dge 'dun gnas 'dus pa'i gtsug lag khang ngam sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i mchod rten dri gtsang khang du bya'o //
translated: As for sweeping the ground and making mandalas as in the second Sutra, you should do these in a temple where the Sangha is gathered or in a stupa that contains a Buddha relic.

original: gzhan du byas pa'i sa ni las su mi chud do //
analyzed: gzhan du byas pa'i sa ni las su mi chud do //
translated: If you do them elsewhere, they are not considered to be effective.
